Body: I would like to force a few apps in particular to not stop when I boot, reboot, etc. The reason why is irrelevant ... I would like to know if or how Aneroid OSes, in general, load apps into memory, and how I can alter the part of it that does that to load only what I wish(including system processes, of course). How can this be done?Again, I would like to prevent them from starting, or going to memory at all, not just kill them after they'ce started.Short of what conditions, how can this be done?
Title: Hello. How can I forcibly prevent specific apps from starting at boot?

history.Text: I would like to force a few apps in particular to not stop when I boot, reboot, etc. The reason why is irrelevant ... I would like to know if or how Aneroid OSes, in general, load apps into memory, and how I can alter the part of it that does that to load only what I wish(including system processes, of course). How can this be done?Again, I would like to prevent them from starting, or going to memory at all, not just kill them after they'ce started.Short of what conditions, how can this be done?
Hello. How can I forcibly prevent specific apps from starting at boot?
